sources.title: The Forty-First
sources.description:
Years of civil war. A detachment of Red Army soldiers is moving along the white sands of Central Asia. The best shooter of detachment - Maryutka, had forty killed White Guards on the combat account. In the last battle, lieutenant Govorukha-Otrok was captured. He will become the forty-first in her track record when they are alone in the space of sand, sky, sea and complex feelings.

IMDb: 7,5

Year of production: 1956

Director: Chukhrai Grigory
Screenwriter: Grigory Koltunov
Composer: Kryukov Nikolay
Operator: Urusevsky Sergey
Production Designers: Stepanov Konstantin, Kamsky Vladimir

Cast: Oleg Strizhenov, Daniil Netrebin, Isolda Izvitskaya, Petr Lyubeshkin, Nikolay Dupak, Vadim Zakharchenko, Alexander Grechany, Kirei Zharkimbaev, Anatoly Kokorin, Lev Kovylin, Nikolai Kryuchkov, Yury Romanov, T. Sardarbekova, Vladimir Sinitsyn, Asanbek Umuraliev (Arsen ), Shapovalov Georgy

metadata.Plot: A detachment of the Red Army led by Commissar Yevsyukov is moving along the sands of the Central Asian desert, pursued by whites, dying of thirst. Forty killed officers were on the battle account of the best shooter of the Maryutka detachment. In the last battle to capture the caravan, the white lieutenant Govorukha-Otrok was taken prisoner, sent on a diplomatic mission from Admiral Kolchak to General Denikin. The soldiers are trying to return to their own, fighting the hostile desert. Finally, they go to the coast of the Aral Sea, where Maria, Govorukha-Otrok and several fighters take a boat to reach the mainland. All Red Army soldiers die during a storm, and Maria and Lieutenant are thrown alone on the island.
metadata.Actors: Izolda Izvitskaya, Oleg Strizhenov, Nikolay Kryuchkov
